medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early adolescence and included episodes of syncope typically after prolonged standing or walking, beginning with a prodrome of diaphoresis and blurred vision. Despite self-taught maneuvers to alleviate symptoms, the patient was limited by frequent syncope and stopped attending school at age 16.
medical_history.family_history: Both her brother and paternal uncle had severe pectus excavatum, suggesting an autosomal dominant inheritance pattern.
